Kinda regret reading this. Yeah, the art is hot which is great but snuff does not sit well with me at all. It's gross. IMO it woulda been much better if there was like, a redemption arc or something where the slime just copies the appearance instead. It can do that as demonstrated in the alleyway. The rest was all unnecessary and that dude pisses me off where he was just okay with this whole thing. I woulda expected more backlash but since he just went with it I lost all respect.

"Dude it's a hentai just chill." Whatever.

I think what the slime so trying to say is that she didn't really killed them but instead absorbed them gaining all of their memories and personality.

This can be seen when all of the split slimes of each individual girls started acting on their own and the slime saying she has no full control of the other split slime with the personality of each girls.

I guess from what I understand the slime did consumed the girls but when she split she basically spew out their personality and memories and each gave them their own individual slime bodies. But still all of them are bound to the original slime in this wierd hive mind that influence them on liking the MC since the original Slime loved the MC

Halo: Combat Evolved is a 2001 first-person shooter game developed by Bungie and published by Microsoft Game Studios. It was released as a launch game for Microsoft's Xbox video game console on November 15, 2001. Microsoft released versions of the game for Windows and Mac OS X in 2003. The game was later released as a downloadable Xbox Original for the Xbox 360. Halo is set in the twenty-sixth century, with the player assuming the role of the Master Chief, a cybernetically enhanced super soldier. The Chief is accompanied by Cortana, an artificial intelligence. Players battle aliens as they attempt to uncover the secrets of the eponymous Halo, a ring-shaped artificial world.

Its kinda scary how realistic the depiction of the mc is. He isnt overly malicious, in fact a pacifist to a fault. He avoids conflict at all cost and doesn't want to be a bother to others, but he also is no martyr and act against injustice. Its kinda like a person who messages thoughts and prayers to a tragic event or just stand idly while a classmate is being bullied thinking someone else should take care of this. Too many are like this.

I'd say I was actually pleasantly surprised at the story. It's a bit shoved in your face but it's easily missable. MC is a horrible person, he overlooks being screwed over and other people being murdered just so he doesn't have to confront anyone. The reason this didn't completely kill my soul (as I was wanting him dead after he decided to just both ignore and encourage it) is because his personality is actually preferred by the slimes, as we can see another person who was actively taking advantage of the slime's ability to assimilate was murdered in cold blood because of his lack of care. MC on the other hand, genuinely cares about the slime and since he's suck a bitch he doesn't confront the slime about its actions, allowing the slime to freely please him without feeling like it's being used.

@izumi_weebx I'd say so long as he didn't see what you were rubbing it to you'll be completely good. There's no getting around the fact that everyone jerks off, you're already way past the age where you need to have a "talk" with that awkward ass scenario. If your dad did, then that's just rough. If he ignores it, do it to, and hope that he does.

My only issue to this doujin would be the girls being assimilated to slime. I mean the author could've worked around with that power without the real thing being gone... My brain processes the person differently being the original incarnate and the slime incarnate no matter how the author pushes the narrative that they're the "same" even if they were assimilated. In reality, they're just not really the same. Ngl, the art is just that good which compels me more to read even if the slime commits female genocide.

I love how this story takes the typical jp beta mc sterotype that is usually portrayed as a virtue and shows that he isn’t “kind” or whatever else they get usually get sold as. He is a pacifist that doesn’t want to argue over getting his foot intentionally stomped on, but he is also okay with completely innocent strangers dying for his benefit. He doesn’t care about the morality of having a conflict; he just doesn’t want friction in his life. From personal experience this depiction is more realistic, and it feels like this doujin is a good slap against all the works that glorify that shitty personality type.
